list.name: Changes
list.comment:
refactor(router): simplify route structure using Layout component
Replaced ElementWithBackground wrapper with a new Layout component for improved code organization. Simplified route definitions by nesting them under a single Layout wrapper. Maintained existing paths and components while enhancing readability and scalability

task.summary: Default task
Changed the generate from athletes to only update battles in tournament store
Changed the generate from athletes to only update battles in tournament store
Introduced constants for role string values
Introduced constants for role string values

Fetch athlete data from Firestore.
Updated the HomePage to fetch athlete data from the Firestore athletes collection using a new helper function. Modified relevant type definitions and constants, and replaced the query-based approach with Firebase functions.

Updated tournament Data structure to hold last battle & third place battle info
Added reducers to tournament slice: - setter for isFinalDifferent - setter for hasThirdPlaceBattle - setter for Athletes in Finale Battle - modified generateBattlesFromAthletes payload to accept a value to set for the final round or timer value
Tournament Config now offers input to allow for third place battles & final battle specifications
generateTournamentBattlesFromAthletes now handles adding a battle for the third place and specifying a different round or timer value for the final battle

Updated Battles to handle the third place battle feature
Winning now doesn't just put the winnner in next battle it also takes into account the looser potentially going to third place battle
Setting the winner of a battle now automatically sets the loosers in battleSlice

Updated Battles to handle the third place battle feature
Winning now doesn't just put the winnner in next battle it also takes into account the looser potentially going to third place battle
Setting the winner of a battle now automatically sets the loosers in battleSlice
Bracekt display works, third place battle is done before actual final, but a better way of displaying this should be found !

Added two sided bracket,
This breaks the display of the Third place Battle, a custom version of the bracket will need to be created to fix this issue.
The third place battle is still in the Tournament it just is not displayed by the two sided bracket
Switched default id values to empty string Updated Firestore object sanitasation

Refactor battle and tournament data handling with Firebase updates
BattleSlice.ts: Added order property to manage battle order in state. TournamentSlice.tsx: Introduced setTournamentId action for easier tournament ID management. Helpers.ts: Renamed Firebase interaction functions (e.g., addAthletesToTournament → firebaseAddAthletesToTournament) for clarity. Modified functions to return data objects, enabling better handling of asynchronous operations. Added return values for data updates to streamline feedback and logging. Battle.tsx: Integrated firebaseSetBattleInTournament for asynchronous battle updates and addressed TypeScript errors.
This patch improves Firebase data handling, enforces naming consistency, and enhances asynchronous functionality.
On Start tournament now updated the store with Id values from firebase

update HostView and SpectatorView to display and manage tournaments
HostView.tsx: Added a TournamentList component to display hosted tournaments. Fetched tournaments based on the current host's UID. Improved layout with a title and centralized grid components. TournamentConfig.tsx: Updated text in the button and dialog to emphasize tournament creation. SpectatorView.tsx: Simplified layout, removing the redundant button and navigation logic. TournamentList.tsx: Refactored to include a title prop and an option to navigate to the selected tournament. Enhanced navigation functionality using useNavigate. helpers.ts: Modified firebaseGetTournamentsCollection to accept query constraints. Refactored the data fetching logic for better efficiency and error handling.
Fixed Button within button spawning an JS error
Fixed Key uniqueness error
Fixed Key uniqueness error
Fixed Key uniqueness error & Streamlined the firebase battle update function

feat: add tournament update functionality with Firebase integration
- Enhanced athlete handling in battles: Automatically fills missing athletes in battles with one participant. - Implemented `firebaseUpdateTournamentBattles` for bulk battle updates in Firebase. - Introduced `firebaseUpdateTournamentDocument` to update tournament details and associated battles in Firebase. - Updated `TournamentPage` to support conditional Firebase updates based on navigation state. - Adjusted battle navigation in `BattlePage` to trigger Firebase updates upon returning to the tournament view.
This commit ensures seamless synchronization between the app's state and Firebase for tournaments and battles.
Fixed bug created by trying to get a list of unique athletes from tournament by typecasting to Set with objects being equal but with different references, now using ID equality to check unicity
Moved TournamentList to Home Components rather then Home/Spectator as it is now used in both spectator and host views Removed some debug console statements

feat: restructure tournament views and enhance battle data management
- Split tournament page logic into `TournamentHostView` and `TournamentSpectatorView` components for clearer role-based separation. - Refactored Firebase battle document mapping into a reusable helper function `convertFirebaseBattleDocumentToIBattle`. - Added a real-time listener for tournament battles (`firebaseSetTournamentBattlesListener`) to keep spectators updated dynamically. - Renamed `setBattles` reducer to `setTournamentBattles` for better clarity. - Updated file imports to ensure consistent case-sensitive paths. - Simplified `TournamentPage` by delegating specific role views to separate components.

Refactor and enhance tournament management components and helpers
- Add state management to prevent duplicate tournament updates in `TournamentHostView`. - Display the tournament bracket alongside the winner in both `TournamentHostView` and `TournamentSpectatorView`. - Simplify Firebase helper functions by removing unnecessary try-catch blocks for better error propagation: - `firebaseSetBattleInTournament` - `firebaseUpdateTournamentDocument` - `firebaseAddTournamentDocument` - `firebaseUpdateTournamentAthlete` - Remove redundant console.log statements to clean up debug outputs. - Refine `mapBattleListToReactBracketRoundList` to streamline battle mapping.

feat: add theme management with background customization
- Introduced `themeSlice` to manage application themes using Redux Toolkit. - Added support for dynamic palette, typography, and background configuration. - Defined `IBackgroundOptions` interface for managing theme backgrounds with URLs. - Updated `Theme` and `ThemeOptions` in Material-UI to include `background` property. - Integrated `themeReducer` into the Redux store.
This feature enables centralized and customizable theme handling, improving scalability and maintainability.

refactor: update theme management and integrate ThemeProvider
- Updated default font family in `themeSlice` from "Nunito Sans" to "Lato". - Renamed selectors in `themeSlice` for improved clarity: - `selectTheme` → `selectThemeOptions` - `selectThemePalette` → `selectThemePaletteOptions` - `selectThemeBackground` → `selectThemeBackgroundOptions` - `selectThemeTypography` → `selectThemeTypographyOptions`. - Removed redundant `.catch` blocks from Firebase `getDocs` calls in `helpers.ts`. - Integrated Material-UI's `ThemeProvider` into `App.tsx`, using Redux state for theme configuration.
This refactor improves code readability, reduces error-prone redundancies, and centralizes theme configuration for a cleaner, more scalable architecture.
Refactor theme management: Removed themeSlice and integrated theme options into tournamentSlice. Updated store and App components accordingly.

### Commit Message **feat: Firebase hosting setup and theming enhancements**
### Description - **Firebase Hosting**: - Added `.firebaserc` and `firebase.json` for Firebase project configuration. - Configured GitHub Actions workflows for Firebase hosting: - Deployment on `master` merges. - Previews for pull requests.
- **State Management**: - Introduced theming options to `ITournament` in `tournamentSlice`. - Added reducers and selectors for dynamic theme customization (palette, typography, background).
- **Refactor**: - Renamed `src/app/types.ts` to `src/app/types.d.ts` and added theme-related types.
- **UI Fix**: - Updated `Details.tsx` to safely access optional `image` properties of athletes.
- **Cleanup**: - Removed unused `themeSlice` from the store.
- **Assets**: - Added Firebase hosting cache for static assets.
This commit sets up Firebase Hosting and enhances theming capabilities for dynamic tournament customization.
Fixed Github Workflow
Testing githubworkflow
Testing githubworkflow, refactoring imports to work well with Vite
Testing githubworkflow, refactoring imports to work well with Vite
Testing githubworkflow, running commands with PNPM

feat: integrate YouTube video as background and switch to npm for Firebase hosting workflow
- Updated `tournamentSlice.tsx` to replace static background image URL with an embeddable YouTube video URL. - Modified `.github/workflows/firebase-hosting-merge.yml` to switch from `pnpm` to `npm` for dependency installation and build steps, simplifying CI workflow. - Enhanced `App.tsx` to render the YouTube video as a fullscreen background with autoplay, mute, and loop settings.
Fixed bug where Tournaments with no theme would make the display crash, now automatically loading the default theme instead

refactor: rebrand to "Arena Forge" and improve UI components
- Updated site title, descriptions, and main headings to "Arena Forge". - Introduced `ElementWithBackground` component for managing background elements with YouTube videos or static images. - Implemented default background image on the home page. - Created `ThemeConfig` component for configuring battle themes dynamically. - Added `youtubeVideoIdParser` helper function for extracting video IDs from URLs. - Removed unused error logging from `LoadingOrError` component. - Adjusted iframe configurations for a smoother user experience.
Meta Data Update
Simplified ElementWithBackground.tsx css

feat(theme): add dynamic theme customization options and dependency updates
- Introduced new theme customization actions in `tournamentSlice`: - `setTournamentPalettePrimaryColor` and `setTournamentPaletteSecondaryColor` for palette customization. - `setTournamentTypographyBodyFont` and `setTournamentTypographyHeaderFont` for typography customization. - Exported `initialThemeOptions` for external use. - Fixed `zIndex` typo in `ElementWithBackground.tsx`. - Updated dependencies in `package.json`, including `@mui/material` to v6.1.10 and added color/typography-related libraries: - `@uiw/color-convert` - `@uiw/react-color-colorful` - `react-fontpicker-ts-lite`. - Updated IntelliJ workspace metadata for task tracking and simplifications.

feat(theme): implement display settings configuration
- Added `ThemeConfig` component for managing tournament display settings. - Includes primary and secondary color pickers using `@uiw/react-color-colorful`. - Introduced typography customization with body and header font selectors using `react-fontpicker-ts-lite`. - Updated `HostView` to include `ThemeConfig` component. - Replaced `Unstable_Grid2` imports with `Grid2` for stable grid support. - Replaced `xs` prop with `size` for Grid components for improved compatibility and clarity. - Removed unused styles and redundant props in `BattleConfig`.
This change enables organizers to configure the visual theme for tournaments, enhancing customization and user experience.
Update all Grid2 to new packag
Update all Grid2 to new packag
inline athlete card is responsive to viewport size
Fixed more display bugs
Bug fixed on all views

Remove mock data and related API handlers
This commit deletes unused mock data files (athletes.json, fruits.json) and their associated handlers, server setup, and API file (getAthletes.ts). Additionally, it updates the pnpm-lock.yaml to reflect the removal of related dependencies. These changes aim to clean up the codebase by eliminating unused assets.

Refactor Firebase API integration and clean helper functions
Moved Firebase API functions to dedicated modules for better organization and maintainability. Updated import paths across the project to reflect these changes. This improves code modularity and simplifies future scalability.

feat: Add athlete creation API and enhance athlete data retrieval
- Added `firebaseAddAthleteDocument` to create athlete documents in Firestore with support for storing image metadata in a separate collection. - Updated `firebaseGetAthleteCollection` to support named exports for better modularity. - Refactored imports in `HostView.tsx` to align with updated athlete API structure.

feat: Add tabbed navigation for Tournament Host View and update dependencies
- Introduced tabbed navigation using `@mui/lab` components to separate "Create Tournament" and "Resume Tournament" views. - Enhanced UI with `TabList`, `TabPanel`, and `TabContext` for improved organization of host features. - Added new dependencies: - `@mui/lab@6.0.0-beta.21` for tab components. - Updated `@mui/material` to version `^6.3`. - Refactored imports to follow updated folder casing conventions. - Improved type imports for better type safety and event handling.

refactor(router): simplify route structure using Layout component
Replaced ElementWithBackground wrapper with a new Layout component for improved code organization. Simplified route definitions by nesting them under a single Layout wrapper. Maintained existing paths and components while enhancing readability and scalability

### Commit Message **feat: Firebase hosting setup and theming enhancements**
### Description - **Firebase Hosting**: - Added `.firebaserc` and `firebase.json` for Firebase project configuration. - Configured GitHub Actions workflows for Firebase hosting: - Deployment on `master` merges. - Previews for pull requests.
- **State Management**: - Introduced theming options to `ITournament` in `tournamentSlice`. - Added reducers and selectors for dynamic theme customization (palette, typography, background).
- **Refactor**: - Renamed `src/app/types.ts` to `src/app/types.d.ts` and added theme-related types.
- **UI Fix**: - Updated `Details.tsx` to safely access optional `image` properties of athletes.
- **Cleanup**: - Removed unused `themeSlice` from the store.
- **Assets**: - Added Firebase hosting cache for static assets.
This commit sets up Firebase Hosting and enhances theming capabilities for dynamic tournament customization.

- Updated site title, descriptions, and main headings to "Arena Forge". - Introduced `ElementWithBackground` component for managing background elements with YouTube videos or static images. - Implemented default background image on the home page. - Created `ThemeConfig` component for configuring battle themes dynamically. - Added `youtubeVideoIdParser` helper function for extracting video IDs from URLs. - Removed unused error logging from `LoadingOrError` component. - Adjusted iframe configurations for a smoother user experience.

feat(theme): add dynamic theme customization options and dependency updates
- Introduced new theme customization actions in `tournamentSlice`: - `setTournamentPalettePrimaryColor` and `setTournamentPaletteSecondaryColor` for palette customization. - `setTournamentTypographyBodyFont` and `setTournamentTypographyHeaderFont` for typography customization. - Exported `initialThemeOptions` for external use. - Fixed `zIndex` typo in `ElementWithBackground.tsx`. - Updated dependencies in `package.json`, including `@mui/material` to v6.1.10 and added color/typography-related libraries: - `@uiw/color-convert` - `@uiw/react-color-colorful` - `react-fontpicker-ts-lite`. - Updated IntelliJ workspace metadata for task tracking and simplifications.

Remove mock data and related API handlers
This commit deletes unused mock data files (athletes.json, fruits.json) and their associated handlers, server setup, and API file (getAthletes.ts). Additionally, it updates the pnpm-lock.yaml to reflect the removal of related dependencies. These changes aim to clean up the codebase by eliminating unused assets.

Refactor Firestore API handling and improve imports.
Moved Firestore API functions (user, athlete, and tournament) to dedicated files for better modularity. Updated import paths throughout the project to reflect these changes. This cleanup enhances code maintainability and separates concerns effectively.

Refactor Firebase API integration and clean helper functions
Moved Firebase API functions to dedicated modules for better organization and maintainability. Updated import paths across the project to reflect these changes. This improves code modularity and simplifies future scalability.

- Added `firebaseAddAthleteDocument` to create athlete documents in Firestore with support for storing image metadata in a separate collection. - Updated `firebaseGetAthleteCollection` to support named exports for better modularity. - Refactored imports in `HostView.tsx` to align with updated athlete API structure.
